tweets.text: Our Director, @LeeRawlinsonEA is in #Rochdale where a #flood warning has been issued as #StormChristoph makes its way across Greater Manchester. Check your risk, sign up for flood warnings and #prepareactsurvive üëâhttps://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/Rri79XEoya

We currently have 10 flood alerts in place across the #NorthEast with flood gates closed in communities across the region, including #Morpeth and #Yarm - check the latest situation here: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/V1cv2vALyp

tweets.text:
As rain continues to fall on our wet river catchments, #TeamEA are out checking flood defences across the NorthWest

Here one of our operatives is monitoring the temporary defences at Burrow Beck in #Lancaster 

Check your flood risk at https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV

Be #floodaware https://t.co/6suQmFHZDN

Just been down to the river. High but still a way to go. It should be peaking in the coming hours. Thanks to the @EnvAgencyYNE our amazing flood wardens and @slowtheflow_UK volunteer as well as @Calderdale staff for looking out for everyone #StormChristoph https://t.co/4083KwyPNx

urls.title: Flooding - Lancashire County Council
urls.description: If there is an immediate risk to your life or you are trapped by flood water call 999.

tweets.text:
üåßÔ∏è With #FloodWarnings and #FloodAlerts in place for parts of #Lancashire, watch our video for steps to stay safe before, during, and after a flood and see: https://t.co/8Oh91nEOml

Follow @EnvAgencyNW & @TheFloodHub for updates
#LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/jZHobb4Ds8

üì¢ Flood warnings are now being issued for parts of Lancashire, Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire meaning that flooding is expected. 

For the latest warnings visit ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#StormChristoph #Lancashire #GreaterManchester #Cheshire #Merseyside

@balfourbeatty @TelfordWrekin had an early start this morning erecting the herrace fencing to accommodate the @EnvAgency putting up the flood defence phase 1 due to #stormkristof . Flood warnings are out so please stay safe and vigilant ‚õà #ironbridge https://t.co/OVU5H6zB9a

tweets.text:
It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

As floods threaten South #Yorkshire, I'm very grateful for the hard work of the @EnvAgencyYNE, flood wardens, & our local authorities. But once we get through this, we cannot delay any longer the investment we need to protect us for the long term. https://t.co/wDoxRwnD7M

tweets.text: Pictures from Carlisle's River Eden through Rickerby Park this morning. The river's well out of its channel and onto flood plain. The @EnvAgencyNW has a flood warning in place for the Eden in Rickerby Park, and the Met Office yellow rain warning is in place until 1200 on Thurs. https://t.co/YsqTp9cxoX

Businesses in Matlock prepare for Storm Christoph after the @EnvAgencyNW issue flood warning for River Derwent. Water levels are forecast to rise to over 3m in the next 36hrs. https://t.co/qmDCr5U8v2 https://t.co/0OxwHvUEdr

tweets.text:
@PorterHaney @AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice Hi, I'm not sure about its accuracy but live rainfall data can be found on the gaugemap website.
https://t.co/C2a4fXxiqv

The River Loxley at ‚ÄòRowell Bridge level recorder‚Äô a few minutes ago. Swollen, turbulent, angry and still rising. Fingers crossed for the folk downstream of all this! You can check the river level every 15 minutes via @EnvAgency site here: https://t.co/5yC1Z9nYMZ https://t.co/PiN8KzH8fd

We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text:
@HanbyAndrew @riteandleft @olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable Slurry offers many advantages like making it easier to keep cows cleaner and more flexible to handle.

Maize is also a modern thing - a warmer climate crop that's gradually crept north as plant breeding has developed to suit our climate. But it's still a crop that is

@HanbyAndrew @riteandleft @olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable That's right. Slurry is a modern thing - since the 1970's we've had the machinery and systems to handle it but before that cattle tended to be straw bedded which means the muck is more biologically stable and can be stored in field heaps for spreading when ground conditions allow
@CumbriaRain @AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice Hello! Is there a public url for this data? Thanks very much. üôèüèª

@riteandleft @olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils @suesustainable It all just runs off and the soil structures is knackered is my interpretation- over to @Rosewood_Farm who will know what he's talking about, unlike myself.
